definition: plain/informal/suitable/convenient/opportune/to urinate or defecate/equivalent to 就[jiu4]: then/in that case/even if/soon afterwards
to change or replace/to experience/one of the five two-hour periods into which the night was formerly divided/watch (e.g. of a sentry or guard)
convenient/suitable/to facilitate/to make things easy/having money to spare/(euphemism) to relieve oneself
cheap/inexpensive/small advantages/to let sb off lightly
cheap/inexpensive/small advantages/to let sb off lightly
so that/so as to/in order to
(emphasizes that sth is precisely or exactly as stated)/precisely/exactly/even/if/just like/in the same way as
as one wishes/as one pleases/at random/negligent/casual/wanton

sentences.english: E. coli O157:H7 causes abdominal cramping, vomiting and a diarrheal illness, often with bloody stools.
sentences.chinese: H7能引起腹部絞痛，嘔吐和腹瀉，通常是血便。

sentences.english: When her statement was read a very cleat light was cast upon the situation.
sentences.chinese: 她的聲明宣讀後，情況便顯得非常清楚了。

sentences.english: He became garrulous after a few glasses of wine.
sentences.chinese: 他幾杯酒下肚之後便嘮嘮叨叨說個沒完。

sentences.english: Shepherd's purse green season, and grandmother would have to accompany her mother to pick the fields shepherd's purse.
sentences.chinese: 薺菜青青時節，外婆便要母親陪着去田野裏挑薺菜。

sentences.english: The acting career plummeted suddenly, he relied on alcohol to release.
sentences.chinese: 演藝事業突然一落千丈，他便借酒澆愁。

sentences.english: but he left it to him on such terms as destroyed half the value of the bequest .
sentences.chinese: 但是，因爲附有條件，這份遺產便失去了一半價值。

sentences.english: Mr Wei rushed to Taipei during his rest day on a Sunday to see Mr Zhang.
sentences.chinese: 魏姓同學便利用星期日趕到臺北和張先生見面。

sentences.english: Soon he became the top student at school.
sentences.chinese: 很快他便成了學校裏的尖子生。

sentences.english: From that day on, the Klatooinians were property of the Hutt criminal empire.
sentences.chinese: 從那以後，克拉圖因人便歸屬於赫特人的犯罪帝國。

sentences.english: Yu from East Jiangzhou down to the Three Gorges, Three Gorges will begin dredging project.
sentences.chinese: 禹從江州東下來到了三峽，便開始疏浚三峽的工程。

sentences.english: Then when you get older and think back, you’ll be able to enjoy it a second time.
sentences.chinese: 當你年老回首往事時，便能再次享受你的一生。

sentences.english: Our parents didn't want us to marry, so we eloped .
sentences.chinese: 我們的父母親不同意我們結婚，所以我們便私奔。

sentences.english: There was no longer any question of discovering a posteriori laws of social change.
sentences.chinese: 之後便不再有有關社會變革的法則出現。

sentences.english: Around the 4th century AD, the site of the Oita city was once called "Bungo".
sentences.chinese: 大約在公元4世紀，大分市所在地域便被稱爲豐後國。

sentences.english: If I want to buy a car, I have to offer enough money to get it.
sentences.chinese: 若我想買一輛車，便要支付足夠的金錢。

sentences.english: Is the sky in memory of Feiyan, flew over, they left off.
sentences.chinese: 記憶是天空中的飛雁，飛過，便留下過。

definition: at once/right away/only/just (emphasis)/as early as/already/as soon as/then/in that case/as many as/even if/to approach/to move towards/to undertake/to engage in/to suffer/subjected to/to accomplish/to take advantage of/to go with (of foods)/with regard to/concerning
(once) again/also/both... and.../and yet/(used for emphasis) anyway
to watch from a height or distance/to survey
also/too/(in Classical Chinese) final particle implying affirmation
he or him/(used for either sex when the sex is unknown or unimportant)/(used before sb's name for emphasis)/(used as a meaningless mock object)/other/another
a moment ago/just now/(indicating sth happening later than expected)/(preceded by a clause of condition or reason) not until/(followed by a numerical clause) only
